intro: Minuartia chlorosciadia, commonly known as the pale sandwort, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant has hairy, succulent leaves that help it retain moisture in harsh, cold environments. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in tundra and mountainous areas. Its botanical features make it well adapted to survive in extreme climatic conditions.
